intro: Paronychia davrazensis, commonly known as the Davraz Mountain buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Turkey. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its delicate, yellow flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are palmately divided, and it produces small, hairy fruits that contain numerous seeds. Paronychia davrazensis is an example of a rare and specialized flora adapted to harsh mountainous climates.
